comment_data.body: I aussme there can use single_file_support  and root can be use .git folder?
no single_file_support,but i added the `.git` support

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,22 @@
+local util = require 'lspconfig.util'
+
+return {
+  default_config = {
+    cmd = { 'tinymist' },
+    filetypes = { 'typst' },
+    root_dir = function(fname)
+      if util.find_git_ancestor(fname) then
+        return util.find_git_ancestor(fname)
+      else
+        return vim.fn.getcwd()
+      end
+    end,

comment_data.body:
If you use cwd as root, it works, but if you don't carry root initially, it may take time to initialize and cause lagging

comment_data.body:
> but in there this also mean use cwd as root . so i wonder this not work ?

I don't really understand `single_file_support`, but if neovim as a client will somehow provide a root_dir, the lsp will be not problem at all. They we can go with `single_file_support = true`, and let people report issues to that lsp repository if any.

comment_data.body:
some code here , you can find in configs.lua

```lua
        elseif config.single_file_support then
          -- This allows on_new_config to use the parent directory of the file
          -- Effectively this is the root from lspconfig's perspective, as we use
          -- this to attach additional files in the same parent folder to the same server.
          -- We just no longer send rootDirectory or workspaceFolders during initialization.
          if not api.nvim_buf_is_valid(bufnr) or (#bufname ~= 0 and not util.bufname_valid(bufname)) then
            return
          end
          local pseudo_root = #bufname == 0 and pwd or util.path.dirname(util.path.sanitize(bufname))
          M.manager:add(pseudo_root, true, bufnr)
        end
```

comment_regular_data.body:
Overall, I think it should be possible to merge now
`single_file_support = true` can be accepted
Without `single_file_support = true` LSP server doesn't work.

I'm not 100% sure if it does the same thing as adding

```lua
  root_dir = function()
    return vim.fn.getcwd()
  end,
```

Because that is what I normally do if the `root directory:    Not found` with default settings.
